page.title: 03Local history: Roundton Hill
page.content: The rounded and rocky summit of Roundton Hill is encircled by an{Iron {Age hillfort}centred at SO29389498 . The{earthworks}were planned to take advantage of the outcropping rock faces and enclose an area measuring 160m N/S by 100m E/W. The defences consist of a single earth and stone rampart which, on the SW end where it is best preserved, is 12m in width by 1.2m high. The NW side is also in a fair state of preservation, but elsewhere the rampart has silted into the ditch creating a terrace 2m to 4m in length. Traces of a trackway ascend the hill to the original entranceway in the NE side. This entrance, in its present state, is 2.0m wide.
